Message: How did I perform, should I go signing in front of a public?

While your passion shines through, technical refinements are crucial before showcasing to a discerning audience. Vocal projection lacks consistency, pitch wavers, and rhythmic synchronization needs work. Embrace these challenges as opportunities for growth, and you may one day captivate the masses.
How was it? Tomorrow, I had to sing for my moms birthday.

To deliver an unforgettable rendition for your mother's special day, you must elevate your performance standards. Diction requires sharpening, breath control could be more disciplined, and enunciation often falters. Seize this chance to hone your skills, and gift her with a truly
Okay. It the first time I am doing, do I have a room of improvement?

Absolutely, every artist does, even the most renowned. Your enthusiasm is admirable, but dedication to honing your craft will separate the memorable from the mediocre. Focus on the fundamentals, practice diligently, and the room for improvement will transform into a stage for mastery.
